alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 1:21PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River, areas around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...This situation may result in flooding of other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The 8 AM Tuesday webcam image shows Suicide Basin continues to drain slowly. However, Mendenhall Lake has not drastically responded to the additional inflow of water other than from heavy rain that occurred throughout Tuesday morning. Over time, a path may form for the basin to drain at an accelerated rate. Looking at previous release dates combined with current water levels, best estimations show Mendenhall Lake could exceed moderate flood stage. We continue to monitor the situation and will update this statement with the latest information available. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall Lake and River, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
